intro: Solea microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf solea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
